summary: The Coastal Infrastructure Improvement Act directs the Secretary of the Army to implement a 6-year program for research and development of stabilization and erosion control technology to combat coastal erosion. The program will focus on biomimetic methods, applications for coastal areas, and alternatives to traditional structures. The Secretary will ensure geographic diversity in testing and must submit a report to the relevant congressional committees. The bill defines key terms, including "biomimetic method" and "Secretary."
